articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: A moderate lawmaker will face Iran supreme leader's protege in a run-off presidential election on July 5 after the country's interior ministry said on Saturday that no candidate secured enough votes in the first round of voting.
articles.title: Khamenei protege, sole moderate to battle in Iran's presidential run-off

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: In an election campaign dominated by hardliners, Iranian presidential hopeful Massoud Pezeshkian stood out as a moderate, backing women's rights, more social freedoms, cautious detente with the West and economic reform.
articles.title: Moderate Pezeshkian makes it to Iran presidential run-off

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Saeed Jalili, a zealous ideologue loyal to Iran's supreme leader, plans to resolve the country's social, political and economic ills by adhering rigidly to the hardline ideals of the 1979 Islamic Revolution if he wins the country's presidential election.
articles.title: Iran presidential candidate Jalili is fiercely loyal to Khamenei

articles.author: Alexandra Valencia
articles.description: The gun - a 9-milimeter pistol - blazed a violent trail even by the standards of one of Ecuador's most dangerous neighborhoods, the Nueva Prosperina precinct of Guayaquil.
articles.title: One gun, 34 dead: Inside Ecuador's war on black-market weapons

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: North Korea criticised a joint military exercise by South Korea, Japan and the United States held this month, state media said on Sunday, saying such drills show the relationship among three countries has developed into "the Asian version of NATO".
articles.title: North Korea blames South Korea, U.S. and Japan ties as Asian version of NATO

articles.author: Kissima Diagana
articles.description: Mauritanians head to the polls on Saturday in a presidential election that sees incumbent Mohamed Ould Ghazouani taking on six challengers in the West African desert nation that will soon become a gas producer.
articles.title: Mauritanians go to the polls as Ghazouani seeks re-election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A senior official of the militant Islamist group Hamas, Osama Hamdan, said on Saturday there has been no progress in ceasefire talks with Israel over the Gaza war.
articles.title: No progress in Gaza ceasefire talks with Israel, says Hamas official

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An attacker who fired a crossbow at a police officer guarding the Israeli embassy in Belgrade was shot and killed on Saturday in what Interior Minister Ivica Dacic called a terrorist attack against Serbia.
articles.title: Attacker killed after firing crossbow at policeman guarding Israeli embassy in Serbia

articles.author: Sarah Marsh
articles.description: Leaders of the far-right Alternative for Germany on Saturday reported a surge in membership and vowed to build on its success in the European Parliament election as it targets wins in three state votes in the east this year.
articles.title: Far-right Alternative for Germany reports surge in membership

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz said on Saturday that Iran's message of an "obliterating war" made it worthy of destruction.
articles.title: Israel FM to Iran: regime threatening destruction deserves destruction
